ArabicTitle: مِنْ سِفْرِ أَيُّوبَ الْصِدِيقِ بَرَكَتْهُ الْمُقدَّسَةُ فَلْتَكُنْ مَعَنَا. آمين . ( ٣٦ : ١ - ٣٣ )

Hymn.Arabic: ثُمَّ عَادَ أَليَهُو فَقَالَ:
Hymn.English: Elihu also proceeded and said:

Hymn.Arabic: اِصْبِرْ عَليَّ قَلِيلًا ، فَأَبَيْنَ لَكَ فَإِنَّ لِي عَنِ اللَّهِ أَقْوَالًا أُخْرَى.
Hymn.English: 2 “Bear with me a little, and I will show you That there are yet words to speak on God’s behalf.

Hymn.Arabic: إِنِّي أَتَّخِذُ عِلْمِي مِنْ بُعْدٍ ، وَأُثْبِتُ الْعَدْلَ لِصَانِعِي
Hymn.English: 3 I will fetch my knowledge from afar; I will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

Hymn.Arabic: وَعَلَى الْحَقِيقَةِ فَإِنَّ أَقْوَالِي لَا كَذِبَ فِيهَا. بَلْ هِيَ لَدَيْكَ كَمَالُ الْيَقِينِ.
Hymn.English: 4 For truly my words are not false; One who is perfect in knowledge is with you.

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَظِيمٌ. وَهُوَ لَا يَزْدَرِي أَحَدًا . عَظِيمُ الْقُدْرَةِ وَالْحِكْمَةِ.
Hymn.English: 5 “Behold, God is mighty, but despises no one; He is mighty in strength of understanding.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا يُحْيِي الْمُنَافِقَ ، وَيَقْضِي حَقَّ الْبَائِسِينَ.
Hymn.English: 6 He does not preserve the life of the wicked, But gives justice to the oppressed.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا يَصْرِفْ طَرْفَهُ عَنِ الصَّدِيقِ ، وَالْمُلُوكُ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ هُوَ يُمَكِّنُهُمْ عَلَى الدَّوَامِ ، فَيَرْتَفِعُونَ.
Hymn.English: 7 He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous; But they are on the throne with kings, For He has seated them forever, And they are exalted.

Hymn.Arabic: وَإِذَا أُوثِقُوا بِالْقُيُودِ ، وَنَشِبُوا فِي حَبَائِلِ السَّقَاءِ ،
Hymn.English: 8 And if they are bound in fetters, Held in the cords of affliction,

Hymn.Arabic: يُنْبِئُهُمْ بِأَعْمَالِهِمْ وَمَعَاصِيهِمْ ، إِذَا تَجَبَّرُوا ،
Hymn.English: 9 Then He tells them their work and their transgressions— That they have acted defiantly.

Hymn.Arabic: وَيَفْتَحُ آذَانَهُمْ لِلتَّأْدِيبِ ، وَيَأْمُرُهُمْ بِالْإِقْلَاعِ عَنِ الْإِثْمِ.
Hymn.English: 10 He also opens their ear to instruction, And commands that they turn from iniquity.

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنْ سَمِعُوا وَأَطَاعُوا قَضَوْا أَيَّامَهُمْ فِي الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَسِنِيهِمْ فِي النِّعَمِ.
Hymn.English: 11 If they obey and serve Him, They shall spend their days in prosperity, And their years in pleasures.

Hymn.Arabic: وَإِنْ لَمْ يَسْمَعُوا ، هَلَكُوا بِحَدِ السَّيْفِ ، وَفَاضَتْ أَرْوَاحُهُمْ , وَهُمْ بِلَا حِكْمَةٍ.
Hymn.English: 12 But if they do not obey, They shall perish by the sword, And they shall die without knowledge.

Hymn.Arabic: لَكِنَّ مُنَافِقِي الْقُلُوبِ يَذْخَرُونَ لَهُمْ غَضَبًا غَيْرَ مُسْتَغِيثِينَ فِي قُيُودِهِمْ
Hymn.English: 13 “But the hypocrites in heart store up wrath; They do not cry for help when He binds them.

Hymn.Arabic: تَمُوتُ نُفُوسُهُمْ فِي الصِّبَا، وَحَيَاتُهُمْ حَيَاةُ الْمُخَنَّثِينَ.
Hymn.English: 14 They die in youth, And their life ends among the [g]perverted persons.

Hymn.Arabic: أَمَّا الْبَائِسُ فَيُخَلِّصُهُ مِنْ بُؤْسِهِ وَفِي الضَّغْطِ يَفْتَحُ أَذَانَهُ.
Hymn.English: 15 He delivers the poor in their affliction, And opens their ears in oppression.

Hymn.Arabic: وَهَكَذَا يَجْتَذِبُكَ مِنْ فَمِ الضِيْقِ إِلَى رُحْبٍ لَا ضَنْكَ فِيهِ ، وَيَمْلأُ أَطْعِمَةَ مَائِدَتِكَ دَسَمًا.
Hymn.English: 16 “Indeed He would have brought you out of dire distress, Into a broad place where there is no restraint; And what is set on your table would be full of richness.

Hymn.Arabic: وَلَكِنْ إِذَا اسْتَوْفَيْتَ دَعْوَى النِّفَاقِ ، فَالدَّعْوَى وَالْقَضَاءُ يُمْسِكَانِكَ
Hymn.English: 17 But you are filled with the judgment due the wicked; Judgment and justice take hold of you.

Hymn.Arabic: لِأَنَّكَ فِي حَالِ سُخْطِهِ فَرُبَّمَا اجْتَذَبَكَ بِضَرْبَةٍ. فَلَا يُخَلِّصُكَ الْفِدَاءُ الْكَثِيرُ.
Hymn.English: 18 Because there is wrath, beware lest He take you away with one blow; For a large ransom would not help you avoid it.

Hymn.Arabic: أَفِي ضَنْكٍ هُوَ فَيَعْتَبِرَ يَسَارَكَ وَجَمِيعَ أَرْكَانِ اقْتِدَارِكَ.
Hymn.English: 19 Will your riches, Or all the mighty forces, Keep you from distress?

Hymn.Arabic: لَا تَتَشَوَّقْ إِلَى اللَّيْلِ لِتُغِيرَ عَلَى الْقَبَائِلِ فِي مَوَاضِعِهِمْ
Hymn.English: 20 Do not desire the night, When people are cut off in their place.

Hymn.Arabic: اِحْذَرُ. أَنْ تَتَّجِهَ إِلَى الْإِثْمِ فَإِنَّكَ لِأَجْلِ ذَلِكَ مُنِيتَ بِالْبُؤْسِ.
Hymn.English: 21 Take heed, do not turn to iniquity, For you have chosen this rather than affliction.

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ مُتَعَالٍ بِقُدْرَتِهِ. فَمَنْ يُمَاثِلُهُ فِي الْمُتَشَرِّعِينَ؟
Hymn.English: 22 “Behold, God is exalted by His power; Who teaches like Him?

Hymn.Arabic: مَنْ سَنَّ لَهُ طَرِيقَهُ ، أَوْ قَالَ لَهُ: قَدْ فَعَلْتَ شَرًّا ؟
Hymn.English: 23 Who has assigned Him His way, Or who has said, ‘You have done wrong’?

Hymn.Arabic: اذْكُرُ أَنْ تُعَظِّمَ عَمَلَهُ الَّذِي تُرَنِّمُ بِهِ الْأَنَامُ.
Hymn.English: 24 “Remember to magnify His work, Of which men have sung.

Hymn.Arabic: كُلُّ بَشَرٍ يَرَاهُ ، وَالْإِنْسَانُ يُبْصِرُهُ مِنْ بَعِيدٍ
Hymn.English: 25 Everyone has seen it; Man looks on it from afar. 26 “Behold, God is great, and we do not know Him; Nor can the number of His years be discovered.

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَظِيمٌ فَوْقَ مَا نَعْلَمُ وَعَدَدُ سِنِيهِ لَا يُحْصَى.
Hymn.English: 27 For He draws up drops of water, Which distill as rain from the mist,

Hymn.Arabic: يَجْذِبُ قِطَارَ الْمَاءِ ، ثُمَّ تَهْطِلُ مَطَرًا لِثِقْلِهَا .
Hymn.English: 28 Which the clouds drop down And pour abundantly on man.

Hymn.Arabic: تُفِيضُهَا الْغُيُومُ وَتَصُبُّهَا عَلَى الْبَشَرِ وَبَلاً.
Hymn.English: 29 Indeed, can anyone understand the spreading of clouds, The thunder from His canopy?

Hymn.Arabic: فَهَلْ مَنْ يَفْهَمُ كَيْفَ انْتِشَارُ السُّحُب ؟ وَكَيْفَ قَصِيفُ مِظَلَّتِهِ ؟
Hymn.English: 30 Look, He scatters His light upon it, And covers the depths of the sea.

Hymn.Arabic: يَنْشُرُ نَورَهُ عَلَيْهِ ، وَيَتَسَرْبَلُ بِغِمَارِ الْبَحْرِ
Hymn.English: 31 For by these He judges the peoples; He gives food in abundance.

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّهُ بِذَلِكَ يَدِيْنُ الشُّعُوبَ ، وَيَرْزُقُهُمْ طَعَامًا وَافِرًا.
Hymn.English: 32 He covers His hands with lightning, And commands it to [h]strike.

Hymn.Arabic: يَكْسُو كَفَّيْهِ بِالنُّورِ ، وَيَأْمُرُهُمَا بِتَنْكِيلِ الْمُعْتَدِي.
Hymn.English: 33 His thunder declares it, The cattle also, concerning [i]the rising storm.
